Introduction

Suit is "an HTML/CSS framework for creating loosely coupled UI components". Full details can be found in the documentation.

For components developed specifically for BBC projects, the SUIT CSS framework and style guide is used. This makes it simple for other developers to contribute and keeps the code base maintainable. Please familiarise yourself before using components or contributing.

Using with Bootstrap

SUIT CSS components can make use of Bootstrap in two ways. The best way is to use Bootstrap classes as a utility class: {% highlight html %}

{% endhighlight %}

Alternatively, you can create a utility class that mixes in an existing Bootstrap class or mixin:

{% highlight css %} .u-someUtil { .btn; .btn-primary; }{% endhighlight %}

The first option is preferred unless you need to add a lot of additional declarations to the rule set.
